meanings.sent1: He atones for his mistake by apologizing sincerely.
meanings.sent2: She always atones for her actions by trying to make things right.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter atones for spilling the drink by offering a free dessert.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness atones for any past misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful sunset atones for the long day of hard work.

meanings.definition: To make up for a wrong or injury.
meanings.sent1: He atones for breaking the vase by buying a new one.
meanings.sent2: She atones for her tardiness by staying late to finish her work.
meanings.sent3: The cat atones for knocking over the plant by purring and rubbing against its owner.
meanings.sent4: His dedication atones for any lack of experience.
meanings.sent5: The delicious cake atones for the burnt dinner.
